body: I’m thinking about starting a #vegetablegarden in my backyard. Any advice for a #beginner? #gardening #homegarden

comments.body: Start small! It’s easy to get overwhelmed if you plant too much at once. Focus on a few easy crops like tomatoes or lettuce.
@27182 That’s good advice. I was thinking of planting a lot, but I’ll scale it back for now.
Make sure you check your soil. You might need to add compost or fertilizer depending on where you live.
@14142 I hadn’t even thought about that. How do I know if my soil is good?
You can get a soil test kit from most gardening stores. It’ll tell you if you need to adjust the pH or add nutrients.
Watering consistently is key, especially during the summer. Try to water in the morning to prevent diseases.
@16180 That’s great to know! I’ll make sure to water early. Thanks!
You should try growing herbs like basil or mint. They’re pretty easy and you can use them in cooking right away!
@12345 I love the idea of growing herbs! I think I’ll try basil. Thanks for the suggestion!
